result.execSummary:
The defendant Frankie L Bowlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Concurrent with: present sentence

miscConds.notes:
Restitution total is $522.76 - $359.85 on this case and $162.91 on 15CM576 (dismissed case) to Roundy's.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Pick N Save stores.

Case 15CM576 was dismissed and read into: 15CM577.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. Non-working hours with standard release conditions. To be used at Agent's discretion

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
filed by the state

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Frankie L Bowlin in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:    IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   *CONCURRENT WITH PRESENT SENTENCE*    **transfer allowed to Milwaukee County - NO electronic monitoring**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Pick n Save stores

RESTITUTION:  $359.85 on this case & $162.91 on Case #15CM576  for a total of $522.76 to Roundys  (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions  - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Defendant signed bond
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Frankie L Bowlin did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was supposed to appear by video but the call didn't go through.  Defense moves to reinstate bonds in both cases.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court grants defendant's motion in both cases and orders the signature bonds reinstated with all conditions to remain as previously set.  Defense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
